definition:
Let $R$ be a commutative ring and $\mathfrak{p}$ a prime ideal of $R$.
The [*height*]{} of $\mathfrak{p}$ is the supremum of all integers $n$
such that there exists a chain
$$\mathfrak{p}_0 \subset \cdots \subset \mathfrak{p}_n = \mathfrak{p}$$
of distinct prime ideals. The height of $\mathfrak{p}$ is denoted by
$\operatorname{h}(\mathfrak{p})$.

$\operatorname{h}(\mathfrak{p})$ is also known as the rank of
$\mathfrak{p}$ and the codimension of $\mathfrak{p}$.

The Krull dimension of $R$ is the supremum of the heights of all the
prime ideals of $R$: $$\sup\lbrace \operatorname{h}(\mathfrak{p})
\mid \mathfrak{p}\mbox{ prime in }R \rbrace.$$
